item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Where there is sorrow, there is holy ground." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "She...can talk brillantly upon any subject provided she knows nothing about it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I never put off till tomorrow what I can possibly do - the day after." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Punctuality is the thief of time" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Consistency is the hallmark of the unimaginative." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Life is never fair, and perhaps it is a good thing for most of us that it is not." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Women have a much better time than men in this world; there are far more things forbidden to them." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I choose my friends for their good looks, my acquaintances for their good characters, and my enemies for their good intellects." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Disobedience, in the eyes of any one who has read history, is man's original virtue. It is through disobedience that progress has been made, through disobedience and through rebellion." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am too fond of reading books to care to write them." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You will always be fond of me. I represent to you all the sins you never had the courage to commit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I think God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Yes: I am a dreamer. For a dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Molly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his." -- Oscar Wilde
